results.title: Successful instruction - an illustrated lecture
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions and T.L. Rich
results.brief_description: A dramatised lecture on instruction intended for those learning to teach. A young officer gives a detailed explanation of the three principles of good instruction - prepare and plan; promote and maintain the desire to learn; and confirm that instruction has been assimilated.

results.title: Suburban living: six solutions
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill, ONF | NFB and Richard Gilbert
results.brief_description: A comparison of solutions to the problems of suburban living as found in some of the world’s largest cities - London, Marseille, Rotterdam, Stockholm and Toronto. This film shows housing to delight, amaze, and even provoke. Shown is Marseille’s famous community on stilts, with stores, homes, and playgrounds all within one vertical neighbourhood. Town planners and architects discuss trends and problems.

results.title: Subsistence agriculture: sago
results.brief_description: Sago is the staple food of people in the New Guinea Lowland, this film shows the sago palm, preparation and storage of sago flour and making of sago jelly. Illustrates the susbistence economy and food habits of people living in tropical rainforests.

results.title: subscape_PROOF
results.brief_description:
Traditionally, western cartography combines multiple data sets in a two dimensional representation. The datamapping (cross-referencing of datasets) tells a story - the land use and landforms of a place. Imaginative and politicised choice of datasets creates more esoteric ‘maps’.

sub_scapePROOF uses video/audio footage of televised political rhetoric and confessional TV shows. Onto these are mapped other sources of ‘data’ generated from philosophical and poetic texts.

sub_scapePROOF critiques the notion of evidential, superficial ‘truth’, in a post-faith age. By mapping data from post-colonial locations back onto the language of superpower politics, sub_scape generates a playful and ironic critique on the traditional politics and power dynamics of knowledge-through-mapping.
- Waterson and Richards.

results.title: Submerged glory
results.creator_credit: Alistair Cooke, Frank Jacoby and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International zone”
In every continent there are milestones which mark humanity’s progress from pre-history to the age of the atom. From the temples in Cambodia to the Cathedral in Chartres, these creations stand as a common treasure. Today the temples of Nubia are threatened with inundation by the waters soon to rise at the Aswan Dam; Unesco has called for a worldwide effort to save them.

results.title: Styles of leadership
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold, Roundtable Productions and Arthur Swerdloff
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of the acceptance of a contract by a company which will involve it in stepped-up production and extra work, showing four different ways in which executives can lead their staff and ensure their cooperation.

results.title: Styles
results.creator_credit: Wombat Productions, Inc. and Gene Feldman
results.brief_description: Through separate film portraits, depicts the different life styles of three young people, showing the joys, disappointments, decisions and consequences that shape them. Explains that each person has a different choice because of a different inner self. Steve, a school athlete has turned on to drugs; George, a grandson of an immigrant reflects on the satisfaction gained from a simple life; and Laura, a creative person, reveals herself as detached from the crowd.

results.title: Studying Australian animals
results.brief_description: Scientific investigation of Australian animals at Monash University, illustrating modern technique and equipment in use. Research is shown on territorial behaviour of the Cape Barren Goose, the incubation mounds of the Brush Turkey, growth and temperature regulation of the Parma Wallaby, and hibernation of the Echidna.
